business.headline: Trump's tariff order: India gets key exemptions on several critical mineralsTrump's new tariff order exempts India on copper, lumber, and critical minerals. The order imposes a 26% lower tariff on India compared to China, but experts question the calculation methods. Former diplomat Ashok Sajjanar criticises the non-transparent system and highlights the impact on strategic partnerships in the Indo-Pacific region.

Mixed bag, not a setback: India's first response to Trump's tariffThe Commerce Ministry of India is analysing the impact of the 27% tariff imposed by the US. The ministry states it's a mixed bag and not a setback. Exemptions are expected in sectors like pharmaceuticals, semiconductors, and critical minerals. The tariff ranges from 10% to 27% across various sectors. India aims to sign a Bilateral Trade Agreement with the US by fall this year.

Sun Pharma, Gland, Cipla, Dr Reddy's: Why pharma stocks are rising todayShares of Sun Pharma, Dr Reddy's Laboratories, Gland Pharma, and Cipla rose sharply during early trade, defying the weak trend visible on the broader markets.
Trump tariffs roil Dalal Street, Sensex tanks 500 points, Nifty at 23,200The S&P BSE Sensex fell 344.27 points to 76,273.17, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 80.60 points to 23,251.75 as of 9:31 am.

Why Russia, Canada and these countries were not part of Trump's tariff hit listThe exclusion has raised eyebrows, especially as major trade partners like India (27%), the European Union (20%), and Vietnam (46%) have been slapped with hefty duties. So, why were these countries spared?

Mixed bag, not setback: Government official on Trump's tariffs on IndiaThe new tariffs announced by US President Donald Trump include a universal 10% duty on all imports into the US starting from April 5, with an additional 16% to be applied from April 10.

Stock market opening on April 3: Will Sensex, Nifty fall after Trump tariff?The stock market extended its gains for the second consecutive session in its last session. The Sensex surged 592.93 points to close at 76,617.44, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 166.65 points to end at 23,332.35.

Stocks to watch on April 3: Shares in focus; Maruti Suzuki, Airtel, HDFC BankThe stock market will closely track developments today as several companies such as Maruti Suzuki, HDFC Bank, SpiceJet, and more remain in focus due to key announcements.

What Donald Trump's 27% reciprocal tariff means for IndiaThe 27% reciprocal tariff imposed by US President Donald Trump is a big blow to India's exports, affecting multiple industries. Here's what it means for the Indian economy and also a look at the key sectors at risk.
Wall Street swings in final hours of trading before Trump's tariff announcementUS stocks remained volatile on Wednesday morning in anticipation of President Donald Trump's tariff announcement.

Adani's Mundra Port sets record with 200-MMT annual cargo handlingMundra Port's growing cargo volume further cements its role as India's largest trade gateway. The steady rise in throughput reflects APSEZ's investment in supply chain and logistics infrastructure.

Poonam Gupta is RBI's new Deputy Governor: All you need to knowPoonam Gupta is a well-known economist with nearly 20 years of experience at the World Bank and the International Monetary Fund (IMF). She has also been a government adviser in India.

entertainment.headline: Jasmine Bhasin, Aly Goni to marry in 2025? Actor Krishna Mukherjee answersActor Krishna Mukherjee recently confirmed about friends Aly Goni and Jasmine Bhasin. She shared that the two might get married in 2025.

Actor Jean-Claude Van Damme faces allegations of relations with trafficked womenActor Jean-Claude Van Damme faces criminal charges in Romania over alleged links to a human trafficking case. Prosecutors claim he knowingly engaged with trafficked women at an event in Cannes.

Empuraan box office Day 7: Mohanlal's film witnesses sharp decline in IndiaMohanlal and Prithviraj Sukumaran's L2: Empuraan witnessed a big drop in numbers on Wednesday. The film earned less than Rs 6 crore nett in India on Day 7.

Sikandar box office Day 4: Salman Khan film struggles as earnings drop 50 per centSikandar box office collection Day 4: Salman Khan's film sees a sharp 50% drop on Day 4, earning Rs 19 crore. With Rs 84.25 crore nett in India, the film struggles due to poor reception.

Ektaa Kapoor to revive Kyunki Saas Bhi…with Smriti Irani, Amar Upadhyay: ReportEktaa Kapoor plans to reprise the popular television show, Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi.  The show is expected to return with the original lead pair, Smriti Irani and Amar Upadhyay.

Kareena Kapoor Khan says age is just a number, wants to work all her lifeKareena Kapoor Khan discussed her enduring passion for acting and how age is just a number in her career. The Bollywood star shared her desire to work throughout her life, inspiring many with her dedication.

When Tom Cruise cried after reunion with Val Kilmer on Top Gun Maverick setHollywood stars Tom Cruise and Val Kilmer had an emotional reunion on the set of Top Gun: Maverick. Kilmer died in Los Angeles on Tuesday.

Hunger, poverty, desperation: Ronit Roy on why he started his security agencyActor Ronit Roy shared his journey of being "written off" by Bollywood and starting a security agency due to financial struggles. He also opened up about battling alcoholism and poverty.

Trump to charge reciprocal tariffs of up to 50% on 'worst offenders' globallyTrump Tariffs Announcement Live Updates: US President Donald Trump has announced reciprocal tariffs on all trading partners. Trump has imposed 25 per cent tariffs on Indian goods. World leaders, including the Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney, Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni and the Australian Prime Minister Anthony Aalbanese, have criticised the new tariff rates. The new tariffs will come into effect from April 9, as per a White House official. Watch indiatoday.in for live updates.

Waqf Boards owned 18 lakh acres in 100 years, added 21 lakh acres in last 12The history of Waqf in India started with the gift of two villages in the 12th century. Home Minister Amit Shah stated in Parliament that Waqf boards owned 18 lakh acres from 1913 to 2013. However, 21 lakh acres have been added in the last 12 years. It was in 2013 that the Waqf Act of 1995 was amended. Shah was speaking during the debate on the Waqf Amendment Bill, 2024, tabled earlier on Wednesday.

Trump drops tariff bomb, India hit with 27% duty as trade tensions riseThe sweeping reciprocal tariffs, varying from 10%-49%, rattled global stock markets amid concerns of a wider trade war. India has been hit by a 27% import duty.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna.
